reference.title: Prime Signal List

entry.ph: The common alarm is active, indicating that at least one alarm is active in the system.
One or more urgent alarms that require immediate actions are present.
One or more non urgent alarm that requires actions are present.
There is at least one failure alarm active in the power supply system, rectifier, inverter or static switch.
There is an internal error with for example the EEPROM, flash storage, configuration, firmware, monitoring controller or/and connected power module.
There is at least one communication error active for the display, Modbus, CAN bus, measurement card, monitoring controller or/and connected power module.
The mains is overload, has lost communication, has a configuration or firmware error, or has another warning signal active and will or will not shutdown the system due to abnormal of mains input.
The rectifier is overload, has lost communication, has a configuration or firmware error, or has another warning signal active and will or will not shutdown the system due to abnormal of mains input.
The inverter is overload, has lost communication, has a configuration or firmware error, or has another warning signal active and will or will not shutdown the system due to abnormal of mains input.
There is at least one failure alarm due to voltage, frequency, current is out of tolerance or communication with measurement card is lost.
The bypass is overload, has lost communication, has a configuration or firmware error, or has another warning signal active and will or will not shutdown the system due to abnormal of mains input.
The DC output voltage is below the set low DC voltage warning level.
The DC output voltage is below the set low DC voltage shutdown level.
The DC output voltage is above the set high DC voltage warning level.
The DC output voltage is above the set high DC voltage shutdown level.
The battery is being discharged either because battery operation or a battery capacity test is active.
The battery voltage is either out of range, not connected, has a sensor failure or at low capacity.
The battery charging mode is blocked, battery voltage is too high/low, battery temperature is out of range or battery test is blocked.
Battery temperature is too high/low or out of tolerance. Battery temperature sensor is fault or too high for boost charge.
The input voltage is either over or under voltage, voltage out of tolerance, over or under frequency isolator is open or phase rotation is wrong.
The rectifier unit failed, turned off by the monitoring controller, incorrect configuration/setting or input transformer over-temperature.
The inverter unit failed, input/output out of tolerance, turned off by monitoring controller, incorrect configuration/ setting or output transformer over-temperature.
The inverter has reached the power limit.
The inverter output is out of sync with the bypass or regulation error with sync master.

sl.sli: Check if there is a warning icon on the rectifier or the inverter, if so press on the icon to check what events are active.

entry.ph: The static bypass switch (SBS) failed, bypass voltage, current and frequency out of tolerance, phase rotation is wrong, incorrect configuration/setting, turned off by monitoring controller or bypass transformer over-temperature.
The bypass static switch is either overload or output over current.
One or more of the auxiliary power supply unit (PSU) failed.
There is at least one or more fans in the power blocks or magnetic that is inoperable, rotating at too high/low speed.
The rectifier is in float charge.
The rectifier is in boost charge.
The rectifier is in equalization charge.
The system is in battery operation.
The system is either switched off, in standby mode, or the output voltage, the current or the frequency is out of tolerance.

Peripheral measurement card’s communication is either lost or damage, output is overloaded, the system is in force bypass/inverter operation mode or in static bypass operation, AC earth fault, or an output surge arrestor is tripped.
One or more of the following signals transformer temperature sensor fault, transformer over-temperature, temperature is at warning level or transformer fan failure.
One or more power blocks (rectifier, inverter or SBS) has an over-temperature, fan failure or temperature sensor failure.
The system is in normal operation mode.
The system is in bypass operation mode.
The manual bypass switch is closed and the system is in manual bypass mode.
The inverter is in forced inverter operation.
The system is in emergency power off. This alarm is activate via digital input XG121.
External battery breaker is open. This alarm is activate via digital input XG122.
Boost charge is inhibited. This alarm is activate via digital input XG123.
Distribution input breaker is open. This alarm is activate via digital input XG124.
Distribution feeder is tripped. This alarm is activate via digital input XG125.
Bypass input breaker open. This alarm is activate via digital input XG126.
Input surge arrestor is tripped. This alarm is activate via digital input XG127.
Bypass surge arrestor is tripped. This alarm is activate via digital input XG128.
The system AC earth fault. This alarm is activate via digital input XG129.
The system is in manual bypass. The manual bypass switch is closed. This alarm is activate via digital input X901.
Static bypass switch input breaker is open. This alarm is activate via digital input X902.
Output breaker is open. This alarm is activate via digital input X903.
Battery breaker is open. This alarm is activate via digital input X904.
Mains input breaker is open. This alarm is activate via digital input X905.
DC earth fault external relay is active. This alarm is activate via digital input X906.
Modbus RTU physical device proxy status
The rectifier mains is unavailable or out of tolerance. For tolerances see the Technical Data.

sl.sli: Press on the rectifier icon to check the input values and what events are active.

entry.ph: The rectifier has at least one alarm or warning signal active.

sl.sli: Press on the rectifier icon to check what events are active.

entry.ph: The battery is being discharged either because battery operation or a battery test is active.

sl.sli: Press on the battery icon to check the values and if any events are active.
If the system is not intended to run a battery test, navigate to the battery test page and interrupt the test. For more information see .

entry.ph: The DC voltage is out of the tolerance range. For tolerances see the Technical Data.

sl.sli: Check if there is a warning icon on the rectifier, the inverter or the battery, if so press on the icon to check what events are active.

entry.ph: The battery has at least one alarm or warning signal active.

sl.sli: Press on the battery icon to check what events are active.

entry.ph: The rectifier is in boost charge or equalization charge more. The rectifier output voltage is higher than float voltage.

sl.sli: Press on the rectifier icon to check the values.
If the system is not intended to be in boost charge or equalization charge more, change the charge mode to float charge. For more information see .

entry.ph: The inverter has at least one alarm or warning signal active.

sl.sli: Press on the inverter icon to check what events are active.

entry.ph: The inverter output is unavailable or out of tolerance. For tolerances see the Technical Data.

sl.sli: Press on the inverter icon to check the output values and what events are active.

entry.ph: The system is overloaded. The inverter output current or the bypass current have reached the current limitation. For limit see the Technical Data.
The bypass mains is unavailable or out of tolerance (voltage or frequency). For tolerances see the Technical Data.

sl.sli: Press on the static switch icon to check the input values and what events are active.

entry.ph: The static switch has at least one alarm or warning signal active.

sl.sli: Press on the static bypass switch icon to check what events are active.

entry.ph: One or more parts of the system are overheated. This could be because: The temperature in one or more of the system parts are too high (rectifier, inverter, static switch, transformer) The battery temperature is out of range. The battery temperature sensor is or one or more fans are inoperable. One or more fans are rotating too slow or inoperable.
One or more parts of the system are overheated. This could be because:

sl.sli: The temperature in one or more of the system parts are too high (rectifier, inverter, static switch, transformer).
The battery temperature is out of range.
The battery temperature sensor is or one or more fans are inoperable.
One or more fans are rotating too slow or inoperable.
Check if there is a warning icon on the rectifier, the inverter or the static switch, if so press on the icon to check what events are active.

entry.ph: The system is in manual bypass. The manual bypass breaker is closed and the output is supplied from the bypass mains.

sl.sli: If the system is not intended to be in manual bypass, switch the system to normal operation. For more information see .

The measured value of output voltage on L2–N. [V]
The measured value of output voltage on L3–N. [V]

The measured value of mains voltage L3-L1. [V]

The measured value of mains current L2. [A]
The measured value of mains current L3. [A]
The measured value of mains frequency. [Hz]

The measured value of bypass voltage L3–N. [V]

The measured value of bypass voltage L2–L3. [V]
